name: Bioprocess Technology and Design
description: Building upon CHE353 and CHE354, the aim of this course is to learn and apply engineering principles relevant to bioprocess engineering, including energetics and stoichiometry of cell growth, cell and enzyme kinetics, metabolic modeling, bioreactor design, and bioseparation processes.  In addition to course lectures, students will complete two laboratory exercises that will provide hands-on learning in bioreactor set-up and use.
